comment.body: I used mpc which is a frontend to mpd (music player daemon). The cool thing is that there are a ton of frontends to mpd (mobile, web, GUI, console)
C.H.I.P. can only accept pre-orders payd with PayPal. I cancelled my PayPal account last year ater reading enough horror stories.
@Musickiller: Runtime speed is usually not an issue with GUI toolkits. The user is slower than the computer anyway. I never coded GTK. But QT is really nice to work with.
I once had a similar experience with BitMessage. The delay was about four months.

I remember when I was 12 the bank promised I would get a plastic card with 14. But when I was 14 they didn't deliver without a reason. I remember just too well how pissed off I was. The rules in BitCoin are not changed that easily.
Apart from the traditional methods, how about ipfs or zeronet to make the transfer?

@Musickiller: I use rsync mainly or syncing recursive directory structures. with the -u option only files with newer timestamps are transferred. With the -c option, only files with different checksums are transferred.
They might want to add some privacy before people should use it to distribute movies. Or what kind of files were you thinking about?
How did you take that picture? Some sort of thermal imaging?
From what I read it's only a problem on Windows.
They do different things, but with a similar spirit.
